channel.title: Client & Server problem
channel.description:
I'm Not a leecher This is a new account. Forgot old account & Password [PI] I have 100% Opened Ports on 43594 I know this because i have Use Portforward.com's Port checker & Static IP Automatic setter.
Hey Iv tried so many PI Clients & Servers & No matter what i do i get ' error connecting' on the client when i try to connect.
I Am Using Ports 43594. & a No-ip.info IP
Client Side:
First Problem: ***Client.java*** \/
socketStream = new RSSocket(this, openSocket(5555 + portOff)); - Do i change this to 43594?
I Have Searched for the Current IP Adress In the client folder & Changed it to my own: server = "******.no-ip.info";
Server Side: E:\Users\Gaming\Desktop\Nividia\Server\src\server\ server.java
System.out.println("Server listening on port *******.no-ip.info:" + serverlistenerPort); From There server IP To my server IP
There isn't a GUI.java in the Client folder.
I have used z-filesearcher And searched All Files In these places: E:\Users\Gaming\Desktop\Nividia\Server\src\server E:\Users\Gaming\Desktop\Nividia\Server\src\server\ net E:\Users\Gaming\Desktop\Nividia\Nividia\Client
I have Searched These IP Adress's: .org .no-ip 127.0.0.1 0.0.0.0
& I can't find anything i haven't set MY Ip Address to.
Is there anything I'm missing out?
Please Help, If help given and I can get it all set-up I will be opening Staff spot's to Experienced people.
- Josh

item.title: Client & Server problem
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

[quote=“akz magic, post:8, topic:398546”][quote author=Par link=topic=495679.msg3624013#msg3624013 date=1307673363]
Ok.

I have Edited It to 43594 Correct?

I have compiled the Whole server folder & my IP isnt in any folder.

I Click RUN.bat & I get:

6/10/11 3:32 AM: Server listening on port 43594:43594

I tried to connect to the server & I still get the error connecting. :\

Do you have MSN Or team viewer?
[/quote]

go to i believe it is

then search for

you should then have

Change the

to

No no no no no no no.

item.title: Client & Server problem
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

[quote=“Par, post:3, topic:398546”]Thank’s, I do know java basic’s I know everything about delta\allstar and that its just i dont know ANYTHING about PI.

Ok So in the server.java i have replaced the server.java to the original.
System.out.println(“Server listening on port nividia.zapto.org:” + serverlistenerPort);
What do i do with this? Should i change it to my IP Or port?[/quote]
Knowing how a delta work isn’t the basics of Java, for real though look up the basics, they will help a lot with PI. Change it to your servers port. That makes it so the server knows what port the client is going threw to reach a connection with the server. The Ip doesn’t need to be included in the server files at all in anyway.

Read full topic

Ok So in the server.java i have replaced the server.java to the original.
System.out.println(“Server listening on port nividia.zapto.org:” + serverlistenerPort);
What do i do with this? Should i change it to my IP Or port?

Read full topic

item.title: Client & Server problem
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

For the client side, yes change 5555 to 43594, for the server sided you fucked up the server.java, restore it back to the old version, you should be listening to an IP address server sided. That’s for your server’s port so it knows what to let in (the reason we have to port forward). To change the IP address in the client you have to go into the Client.java file and search for Server or by chance depending on the server 192. . I recommend you learn java basics before you try to host a server.

Read full topic

item.title: Client & Server problem
item.dc:creator: @Par Par
item.description:
@Par wrote:

I’m Not a leecher This is a new account. Forgot old account & Password
[PI]
I have 100% Opened Ports on 43594
I know this because i have Use Portforward.com’s Port checker & Static IP Automatic setter.

Hey Iv tried so many PI Clients & Servers & No matter what i do i get ’ error connecting’ on the client when i try to connect.

I Am Using Ports 43594.
& a No-ip.info IP

Client Side:

First Problem:
Client.java /

socketStream = new RSSocket(this, openSocket(5555 + portOff));

  • Do i change this to 43594?

I Have Searched for the Current IP Adress In the client folder & Changed it to my own:
server = “******.no-ip.info”;

Server Side:
E:\Users\Gaming\Desktop\Nividia\Server\src\server\ server.java

System.out.println(“Server listening on port *******.no-ip.info:” + serverlistenerPort);
From There server IP To my server IP

There isn’t a GUI.java in the Client folder.

I have used z-filesearcher And searched All Files In these places:
E:\Users\Gaming\Desktop\Nividia\Server\src\server
E:\Users\Gaming\Desktop\Nividia\Server\src\server\ net
E:\Users\Gaming\Desktop\Nividia\Nividia\Client

I have Searched These IP Adress’s:
.org
.no-ip
127.0.0.1
0.0.0.0

& I can’t find anything i haven’t set MY Ip Address to.

Is there anything I’m missing out?

Please Help, If help given and I can get it all set-up I will be opening Staff spot’s to Experienced people.

  • Josh
